intro: Matelea bayatensis, commonly known as the Bayatensis Moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and a slight pubescence. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic, typical of many members of its family.
